user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DirectoryClose:
```c
int32 OS_DirectoryClose(osal_id_t dir_id)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Make sure the file descriptor is legit before using it */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_EXCLUSIVE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, dir_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_DirClose_Impl(&token);

        /* Complete the operation via the common routine */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdFinalizeDelete(return_code, &token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_DirectoryClose:
typedef int32_t   int32
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I examined the provided function and the related typedefs for use of compiler-specific language extensions. The snippet contains only: standard C function and block scope, standard typedefs (int32 mapping to int32_t, osal_id_t to an unsigned integral type), a forward declaration typedef for a struct, macro use (OS_SUCCESS), and ordinary function calls and macros as arguments. There are no compiler-extension tokens or constructs present such as __attribute__, __asm, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }) used as expressions, nested functions, label-as-value (&&label), inline assembly, compiler-specific pragmas, Microsoft-specific keywords, GCC/Clang builtin intrinsics, or other documented compiler extensions. The use of identifiers or macros (e.g. OS_LOCK_MODE_EXCLUSIVE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE) does not by itself indicate a language extension. Therefore there are no fragments that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 in the given code.
